title: 113_hr4121
content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes entrepreneurial development programs. The Administrator is mandated to use specific programs for entrepreneurial support services, excluding services for small businesses owned by Indian tribes. An annual report on entrepreneurial development activities must be submitted to relevant committees, detailing program descriptions and operations. The Administrator must submit an annual report to relevant committees detailing entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions, operating details, grant award processes, awardees, funding obligations, and responsible individuals for each program and activity. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

    Small Business Act amended to allow grant recipients to market their services to individuals and small businesses.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

    Small Business Act amended to allow disclosure of information to State, local, Federal agencies, or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION.

    Section 21(a)(3)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include governing data collection activities for grant applicants. The Administrator is required to report annually on data collection activities related to the Small Business Development Center program. SEC. 6. MATCHMAKING AND OTHER EVENTS. Participation in private partnerships and cosponsorships with the Administration by Small Business Development Centers will not limit their ability to collect fees or income related to these activities.

SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Amendments to the Small Business Act regarding equity for SBDCs.

SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. Grant awards to SBDCs. SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Amendments to the Small Business Act regarding equity for SBDCs. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. Grant awards to SBDCs. SEC. 9. DISASTER REFORMS. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses affected by a major disaster, regardless of geographic proximity. The Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses affected by a major disaster under the Stafford Act, ensuring continuity of services and access to disaster recovery facilities. SEC. 10. INCLUSIONS OF ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING FOR UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS. Amends the Small Business Act to include educating unemployed individuals on entrepreneurship and assisting them in starting new businesses.
